short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/: Can you make me move West to get to the pig?
Move me East to get me to the pig!
Move me South to get me to the pig!
Move me North to get me to the pig!
Move me East to get me to the pig!
Move one way, then another to get me to the pig!
Move one way, then another to get me to the pig!
Move one way, then another to get me to the pig!
Move one way, then another to get me to the pig!
Go around the TNT to get me to the pig!
Trace the path and lead me to the silly pig. Avoid TNT or the feathers will fly! Hint: He's South of me.

Let's see what you've learned!
Move one way, then another to get me to the pig.
Move one way, then another to get me to the pig.

Change the code to get me to the pig!
Figure out what is missing and then add blocks to get me to the pig!
Something is not quite right. REMOVE blocks to get me to the pig!
Run through these blocks and fix them! I think I might be going in the wrong direction.
Debug this level by rearranging and changing blocks to get me to the pig!
Debug this level by rearranging and changing blocks to get me to the pig!
Debug this level by rearranging and changing blocks to get me to the pig!
Debug this level by rearranging and adding blocks to get me to the pig!
Debug this level by rearranging and changing blocks to get me to the pig!
Debug this level by rearranging and changing blocks to get me to the pig!

This is a test!

Get three nectar and then make one honey!

Get two nectar to make two honey!
Draw the foot of the man with one line
Draw the whisker on the cat with two lines!
Draw two lines east and two lines north to finish the house!
Draw lines up, over, and down to complete the castle!
Draw the stem of this flower with two lines!
Finish the picture by using a jump block!
Draw and Jump to make the dashed line
Draw and Jump to make the dashed path to the treasure X
Draw this using three lines
Draw the dashed line by using both the jump and draw blocks

You can use a loop to draw many lines in a row.

Can you draw a house? Make it look just the way you like it!  Try looking for patterns that repeat!
Let's play a game! Draw as many X's as you can! Can you get 3 in a row?
Build a three level pyramid, there are no other directions, so just play with the pieces until you get it!
Draw a square below the triangle.
Jump and draw a square next to the house.
Draw a square above the other square
Draw a rectangle to complete the bridge.
Draw a rectangle to complete the bridge supports
Draw two squares to make a rectangle!
Draw a rectangle to give the dresser a top drawer!
Assessment: Draw a square next to the other square.
Draw anything!

"Can you help me spot some bugs? I know which way I want to go, but I'm not sure how many steps to take."

Use three `repeat` loops to get the nectar and make honey!
Use `repeat` loops to get the nectar, make honey, and to move!

Let's get the treasure! Help me across each row then come back to start the next row. Can you find a pattern?
"Where are my friends hiding? Can you write code to show the rest of my friends?"
"Let's have a party! Give my friends something to do when you click or tap them."

Now, draw the same line using a loop.
Can you loop these blocks to draw 6 lines?
Could a loop help us draw the top of this castle?

Loops can help you finish this pattern.

What is the easiest way to draw these stairs?

_"Where are my friends hiding? In this game, clicking on me will show my friend Olive the cat!"_

Clicking Olive will make Robin appear! Can you write code to show the rest of the characters too?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints! The hints will help you do this project step-by-step!

[][0]

_"Let's have a party! Give my friends something to do when you click or tap them."_

What will the animals say? What else will happen?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints! The hints will give you fun things to try!

[][0]

**Tweet!**

_"Can you help me make two bird houses?"_
_"It's time to toss the dice! Can you help me draw these?"_

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_maze_seq_challenge2_a: Try counting the spaces with your finger. Remember not to count the space where you start!

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_maze_seq_challenge1_a: The shortest path might not work this time.

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_maze_seq_challenge1_a: Some paths will lead to TNT, if you move too far.

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_maze_seq_challenge2_a: You do not need to add or remove blocks to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_maze_seq_challenge2_b: Rearrange the blocks and take the middle path.

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_artist_loops_challenge1_a:
You can use loops like this to create the walls and the roof. Try repeating different blocks.

[][0]

Design your own or click the [][1] for some ideas!

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.harvey_tictactoe: You can use `jump` blocks to move to other spaces.

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_a: Try changing the numbers in each loop if something goes wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_b: You don't need to use a loop if you are only doing something one time.
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_c: There are 6 gems on the right side of the cave, but you only need to move and collect 5 times. Do you know why?

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2_b: You only need to use one [][0] block to solve this.
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2_a:
You can move back over the path a second time before moving south.

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_b:
Start by looping the commands `move south` and `get treasure`.

<xml>
  <block type="maze_moveSouth"/><next>
  <block type="collector_collect"/></next>
  </xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_a:
The north pattern is a little different than the south pattern.

<xml>
  <block type="collector_collect"/><next>
  <block type="maze_moveNorth"/></next>next>
  </xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_c:
Move East twice between each path.

<xml>
  <block type="maze_moveEast"/><next>
  <block type="maze_moveEast"/></next>next>
  </xml>

You can do this with only 14 blocks. Click for one more hint to see a solution.
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
Try this!

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
        <title name="TIMES">5</title>
        <statement name="DO">
          <block type="maze_moveSouth">
            <next>
              <block type="collector_collect"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </statement>
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveEast">
                <next>
                  <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
                    <title name="TIMES">5</title>
                    <statement name="DO">
                      <block type="collector_collect">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveNorth"/>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </statement>
                    <next>
                      <block type="maze_moveEast">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveEast">
                            <next>
                              <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
                                <title name="TIMES">5</title>
                                <statement name="DO">
                                  <block type="maze_moveSouth">
                                    <next>
                                      <block type="collector_collect"/>
                                    </next>
                                  </block>
                                </statement>
                              </block>
                            </next>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_a: If something goes wrong, don't be afraid to start over. Don't give up!
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_b:
If you repeat this pattern, Laurel won't hit the wall at the bottom of the cave!

<xml><block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="collector_collect">
                <next>
                  <block type="maze_moveWest">
                    <next>
                      <block type="maze_moveWest">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveSouth"/>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_c: Try using a `repeat` block to collect the final pile of treasure!
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_d:
Try this solution:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
        <title name="TIMES" config="3-10">4</title>
        <statement name="DO">
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="collector_collect">
                <next>
                  <block type="maze_moveWest">
                    <next>
                      <block type="maze_moveWest">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveSouth"/>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </statement>
        <next>
          <block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
            <title name="TIMES" config="3-10">6</title>
            <statement name="DO">
              <block type="collector_collect"/>
            </statement>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_a:
Make Waddles the Penguin show when you click Robin!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_b:
Make Boo the Ghost show when you click Waddles!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_c:
Make Jayden the Fuzzy Monster show when you click Boo!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_d:
Make Spiff the Robot show when you click the monster!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_e:
Finally, make Wendel the Wizard show when you click on Spiff!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">7</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_a:
You can make a bird sing.

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Tweet</title>
          </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_b:
You can make a robot beep.

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
    <next>
      
          <block type="studio_playSound">
            <title name="SOUND">winpoint</title>
          </block>
        </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_c:
You can make an angry monster growl.

<xml>  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
        <title name="VALUE">2</title>
        <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Roar!</title>
            <next>
              <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
                <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
                <title name="VALUE">0</title>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_a: Blocks like this: <xml>  <block type="simple_move_up_left"/></xml> will let your artist move at a slant!
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_b: When you finish one bird house, `jump` to the next!
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_c: You will need a LOT of blocks inside the loop for this challenge.

https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_a: Blocks like this: <xml>  <block type="simple_move_up_right"/></xml> will let your artist move at a slant!
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_b: When you finish one of the dice, `jump` to the next!
https://studio.code.org/s/course1/stage/.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_c: You will need to `move` or `jump` over some of the same lines twice.
